note:
Small and elegant, upright early minuscule. Simple initials introduce each troparion and are located
outside the text block. Titles are written in Alexandrian majuscule

One bifolio of the present manuscript is constituted of one original folio, measured approximately 200x150 mm. The Schriftspiegel is approximately 155x90 mm, with large margins: the upper measures 35 mm (f. 185v), the outer 55 mm (f. 185v), and the lower 40 mm (f. 184r)
Prickings are still visible in the outer margin. They are elongated rather than round, probably made with a penknife. The ruled lines correspond to Sautel-Leroy type 00A1 (Rossetto)

note.value: Description of undertext by Nigel Wilson, Giulia Rossetto

Bibliography: Abbreviation for the edition, MR VI = Μηναῖα τοῦ ὅλου ἐνιαουτοῦ, VI, Ἐν Ῥώμῃ 1901 ; G. Rossetto, Greek Palimpsests at Saint Catherine's Monastery (Sinai): Three Euchologia as Case Studies, Vienna 2022
